Package view

Class WordleTextView

java.lang.Object
view.WordleTextView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class WordleTextView extends Object implements Observer
This class runs a Wordle game in the console. It prompts the user to enter a guess and calculates whether the letters in the guess are close to the actual answer or not. It shows the letters that are in the correct place as capital letters and those that are in the guessed word but not in the correct place are showed as small letters. The user has 6 tried to get to the answer. This class also had two helper methods to help display the guessed character and the user progress in the console. The runText method will be called in Wordle.java to run the game.
Author:
Muhtasim Al-Farabi, Tyler Conklin

  • Constructor Details

    • WordleTextView

      public WordleTextView()
      Constructor

      This method is the constructor for this class. It initializes the model and the controller, and adds this class as an observer of the model.

  • Method Details

    • runText

      public void runText() throws WordleController.OnlyLettersException, WordleController.NotInDictionaryException, WordleController.CorrectLengthException
      Runs the Game once

      This method is responsible for running the game once. It runs a while loop until the game is over and takes guess inputs from the user. It calls the makeGuess method from the controller. It throws exception when an illegal input is given from the user.

      Throws:
      WordleController.OnlyLettersException - if guess contains non-alphabet letter
      WordleController.NotInDictionaryException - if guess is not in the Dictionary.txt file
      WordleController.CorrectLengthException - if guess is not equal to the allowed Length

    • getAnswer

      public String getAnswer()
      Gets answer

      This method returns the getAnswer() method from the controller

      Returns:
      a string that is the actual answer word

    • printChar

      public void printChar​(Character[] guessedChar, utilities.INDEX_RESULT[] guessedIndexResult, ArrayList<Character> unguessed, ArrayList<Character> incorrect, ArrayList<Character> correct, ArrayList<Character> correctWrong)
      Prints incorrectly guessed, partially, correct guessed, and correct guessed characters

      This method prints out the unguessed, incorrectly guessed, partially correct guessed, and correct guessed in the console. It takes in an array of guessed characters and an array of INDEX_RESULT (this tells us about the state of the character). Then, it add the character according to their state in the predefined ArrayLists

      Parameters:
      guessedChar - a Character array with all the guessed characters
      guessedIndexResult - an array of INDEX_RESULT that contain the state of each letter of the given word
      unguessed - an ArrayList of Characters that stores the unguessed letters
      incorrect - an ArrayList of Characters that stores the incorrect letters
      correct - an ArrayList of Characters that stores the unguessed letters
      correctWrong - an ArrayList of Characters that stores the unguessed letters

    • toStringProgress

      public void toStringProgress​(utilities.Guess[] progress, WordleController controller)
      Prints progress

      This method prints out the progress as a 2 dimensional grid of letters and spaces. It prints out the correctly guessed letters in upper case. If it's correctly guessed but on the wrong index, it prints out in lower case

      Parameters:
      progress - an array of Guess elements that contains the current progress of the game
      controller - an instance of the controller class

    • update

      public void update​(Observable o, Object arg)
      This method is called whenever the observed object is changed.

      This method is called whenever the observed object is changed. An application calls an Observable object's notifyObservers method to have all the object's observers notified of the change. Here, it runs the toStringProgress method and the printChar method to display the appropriate changes. It also can access the getProgress method and the getGuessedCharacter method directly from the model instead of the controller.

      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - the observable object
      arg - an argument passed to the notifyObservers method
